title: Ability Scores
description: The six ability scores are Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.
details: Ability scores range from 1 to 20 for most characters
A score of 10 or 11 is average
Ability modifiers are calculated as (score - 10) / 2, rounded down
Strength affects melee attacks and carrying capacity
Dexterity affects armor class, initiative, and ranged attacks
Constitution affects hit points
Intelligence affects spellcasting for wizards and investigation checks
Wisdom affects perception, insight, and spellcasting for clerics and druids
Charisma affects social interactions and spellcasting for bards, sorcerers, and warlocks

title: Saving Throws
description: Saving throws are rolls made to resist harmful effects.
details: There are three types of saving throws: Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution (physical)
And Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma (mental)
You add your ability modifier and proficiency bonus (if proficient) to saving throws
A natural 20 on a saving throw always succeeds
A natural 1 on a saving throw always fails

title: Skill Checks
description: Skill checks determine success or failure of actions.
details: Roll a d20 and add your ability modifier
Add proficiency bonus if you're proficient in that skill
The DM sets the difficulty class (DC) for the check
Common DCs: Very Easy (5), Easy (10), Medium (15), Hard (20), Very Hard (25), Nearly Impossible (30)

title: Combat Basics
description: Combat is turn-based and uses rounds.
details: Each round represents 6 seconds of game time
Initiative determines turn order
On your turn, you can move and take one action
You can also take one bonus action and one reaction per round
Actions include: Attack, Cast a Spell, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, Search, Use an Object

title: Armor Class (AC)
description: Armor Class determines how hard you are to hit.
details: AC = 10 + Dexterity modifier (unarmored)
Armor provides base AC plus potential Dexterity modifier
Shields add +2 to AC
To hit a target, roll d20 + attack modifier >= target's AC

title: Hit Points
description: Hit points represent your health and ability to avoid serious injury.
details: When you take damage, subtract it from your current hit points
At 0 hit points, you fall unconscious
You make death saving throws when at 0 hit points
Three successes stabilize you, three failures mean death
Healing restores hit points
